postTitle: How to connect clients to GHL calendar?
postDescription: How do I send appointments booked from GHL to my clients. I know you can connect Google accounts, surely there is another way to do it without having access to my clients google account, I fear this might drive the client away as raise red flags (It would for me!) Is it possible to just share the calendar with them via a link where they can see each appointment booked and receive notifications? If you have a client, how do you share calendar bookings with them? Please let me know below! Cheers in advance
author: Ralf Mbfy
reply: @Derek Warren @George Ackerley plus on top of that you could consider creating a separate GHL account for them (under Settings > My Staff within 'their' subaccount) with read-only rights ONLY on the Calendar section, everything else toggled OFF (see screenshot).

postTitle: Uneducated Question (since there are no dumb questions)

author: Ralf Mbfy
reply:
@Stormy Knight For every client of yours you're gonna set up a SEPARATE GHL subaccount, with a SEPARATE (set of) phone number(s). On that GHL subaccount you'd then all the business details of your client which would then allow for fetching a phone number (and to get it A2P approved) on their behalf, providing THEIR documentation where required.
However, a much more feasible way that I found is to ask your client to create a Twilio.com account for themselves, fetch a new number inside the Twilio b... See more

postTitle: Sending SMS in France
postDescription: Hi everyone, Merry Christmas ! I've got a potential client who is the CEO of a printing factory in France. I 've watched the videos and saw the formalities needed to send SMS for a company in the US. Any idea/guidance on how it works within France (or Europe) regarding GDPR and other regulations ? Also, in French, there is male/female articles that we don't have in English, since we use "the". So the 2 line SMS "Are you THE same FIRST NAME that contacted us ?" would be different for a man or a woman b... See more
author: Daniel Fawcett
reply:
Yea so the regulations are similar, you need business name, business address and business number as proof to get A2P and regulatory approval.
Also don't take the message literally, adjust for each market so for France you can put
"hello, it's Sarah from Paris Kitchens, is this Marianne who was looking at a kitchen recently?"
To
"Bonjour, c'est Sarah de Paris Kitchens. Est-ce Marianne, celle qui regardait une cuisine r√©cemment¬†?"

postTitle: Stuck on A2P Approvals Approach
postDescription: Can I get approved for A2P to send SMS on a clients behalf to their old customers EVEN IF they never consented to receive SMS, AND they don't have any SMS checkboxes on any forms? If so, what is the right way to fill out the A2P form to get approval in this situation? It seems that ALL contacts must have positively opted in for SMS for the SMS Android strategy to work. Hoping there is a way to get unstuck!
author: Daniel Fawcett
reply:
There are 2 sides to this:
1- A2P registration and regulatory compliance
2-Opted in database of leads.
A2P does not require any proof of any sort of opt in. To get A2P verified you need to show that your current lead gen forms etc have a clear distinct opt in messaging to both transactional and marketing messages etc. This along with your brand compliance, company info, privacy policy and t&c;s etc if done correctly will get you your A2P verified.
The next part is the opted in database, once you hav... See more

postTitle: Where to Start?
postDescription: There are so many great products in this group, and so many awesome giveaways of products, I've accumulated a few already. Which products/services are people's favorites? Which ones were the easiest to implement or most fun to learn and sell? It doesn't matter what I already have, what's your favorite?
author: Daniel Fawcett
reply: The easiest way to start is the Prince Charming Challenge on a DBR basis as its an easy sell to businesses as you are using their old dead leads so they have already written them off and not using them for anything. This way you can contact them all, warm them up and hopefully extract sales. This should then prove the systems and your value to the client. Then you move into S2L (grabbing their brand new or 48-72hr leads and doing the same) and then with all that trust you should be able to sell them the other things easily. Such as google review android etc etc

postTitle: Sarah question?
postDescription: Does Sarah need to send link to calendar and the user needs to click on the link and book a call? Or can Sarah book a call?

postTitle: QUESTION: Best alternative to Twilio/Lead Connector for International numbers?
postDescription: Question, what other alternatives work as well as Lead Connector or Twilio for international numbers that can be used to run SMS, WhatsApp campaigns etc?
author: Ralf Mbfy
reply:
@Sean Busby you could always go down the PHYSICAL phone route by using platforms like e.g. myCRMSIM (https://mycrmsim.com/sms) that come with a full integration with GHL.
In some projects I'm using a competitor of them and it's running like a charm, without any hiccups. 500 - 600 SMSes per day without any issues (US, different sim cards), but in other geos / with other providers the limits might vary.

postTitle: Selling your offer
postDescription: How have you found success with selling the sleeping beauty android? How did you structure the coffee date into an actual agreement to move forward and take action on? The example demo in day 2 seems way to loosey goosey, it mentioned trying the android with a test Pilote of leads but then kinda just ends. Does anyone have recordings of successful calls or even a script/framework for keeping coffee dates succinct and to the point (signed clients/a yes with action behind it)?
author: Daniel Fawcett
reply:
Very basic outline and you need to adjust your words etc but:
1- Once you demo it on the call, then you say do you want to go forwards with a trial>
2 - yes, then give me a test batch of leads, about 1k ideally if they can.
3 - do all the setup and get things working.
4 - run the test leads and hopefully produce some leads to send back that buy the product/service.
5 - once trial is over, jump on another call and discuss results and payment structure going forwards.
6 - if agree then send over a conta... See more

postTitle: DBR: GDPR - Meta compliancy
postDescription: Thinking of running a WhatsApp-based DBR campaign to old Belgian leads who originally enquired via a web form (no explicit WhatsApp opt-in) . How are you handling GDPR + Meta compliance for this?
author: Daniel Fawcett
reply:
Opt in is Opt in for messaging. If there is no specific mention of platform (SMS, email, WA etc) then its a grey area.
The first message always include an Opt Out keyword so the lead can opt out then.
Does the form mention anything about what medium they can be contacted on?

postTitle: DBR: GDPR - Meta compliancy
postDescription: Thinking of running a WhatsApp-based DBR campaign to old Belgian leads who originally enquired via a web form (no explicit WhatsApp opt-in) . How are you handling GDPR + Meta compliance for this?
author: Daniel Fawcett
reply:
@Olivier Muys well you need to have an opt in on your form. So as long as you have one for marketing messages then you should be ok.
Ideally that opt in would state it's WA, SMS, email etc too.
If they are old leads then you just need to know if they have opt in or not. If not then it's a no go really, if yes then you are prob ok.
Meta are not going to know about your old leads from another lead gen source. They will only care about any new forms you use have to have opt in.
Meta plays by its own ru... See more

postTitle: How can I fix people that dont stop talking with the agent

>>>
NEGATIVITY HANDLING (strict)
- Track consecutive negative responses from the lead (e.g., "No", "Not interested", "Stop", "Leave me alone").

postTitle: Start the Instant AI on the $97 GHL starter plan?
postDescription: Is it possible to start the Instant AI on the $97 GHL starter plan?
author: Ralf Mbfy
reply:
Hey @M D yes it's perfect for that. It comes with 3 subaccounts. Set up the 1st one for yourself and your testing. That leaves you with 2 more subaccounts that you can use for your first clients.
Regarding Dan's snapshot: you only import it ONCE - it will end up on the AGENCY level of your GHL account. From there you'll then be able to PUSH the snapshot into each subaccount as required.

postTitle: Zapier not finding my webhook request
postDescription: I am going through setup video 3 of the Prince Charming Challenge and am having issues because Zap is not receiving my webhooks ( it says no request found) so I am not able to test the webhook. Has anybody encountered this issue? What do you recommend?
author: Ralf Mbfy
reply: @Anabelle Alarcon the trick is to use action event "Conversation (Legacy)" - so it's the LEGACY version that you'd need to select. And after that, add your test contact to the "Test Webhook" automation/workflow again. After that everything should be running fine (assuming that you've properly set your zap's URL as the custom value "webhook Prince Charming"...)

postTitle: Zapier not finding my webhook request
postDescription: I am going through setup video 3 of the Prince Charming Challenge and am having issues because Zap is not receiving my webhooks ( it says no request found) so I am not able to test the webhook. Has anybody encountered this issue? What do you recommend?
author: Ralf Mbfy
reply: @Anabelle Alarcon yes exactly, you'd use action event "Conversation (Legacy)" in Zapier. Then in GHL you'd add your test contact to the "Test Webhook" automation/workflow. Then back to Zapier where you'd then (hopefully) see all data from your test contact coming through. Hope that clarifies everything üòÉ

postTitle: Zapier not finding my webhook request

postTitle: No follow up message
postDescription: I‚Äôm having a lot of trouble after sending the first message. Once the prospect responds, they don‚Äôt receive any follow-up messages. What should I check? What are the most common causes of this? Thank you.
author: Daniel Fawcett
reply:
you need to make sure that your zap is receiving data from HL and that you have the webhooks configured correctly.
It could be that your zap is not linked to HL, you are not sending the zap the correct data, or not sending the responses back to HL or something in your workflows.
I would suggest going through the setup guide step by step again carefully to make sure you have completed every step and everything is connected properly.
If you do that and still have issues then post again as it'll likely be a different issue you are facing

postTitle: No follow up message
postDescription: I‚Äôm having a lot of trouble after sending the first message. Once the prospect responds, they don‚Äôt receive any follow-up messages. What should I check? What are the most common causes of this? Thank you.
author: Ralf Mbfy
reply:
@Guillermo Frias make sure that the very last 'custom value' (Webhook: Prince Charming Challenge) is set properly with your zap's URL.
You can find that under Settings > Custom Values.

postTitle: VOICE AI Agent

author: Daniel Fawcett
reply:
You wouldn't want to waste money on voice for DBR as its almost cold calling. The response rate etc will be low and cost lots.
Run the DBR as SMS to their database and if you want voice, use it as inbound only so you can get the leads in your DBR to ring in if they prefer, use it as a voice receptionist etc that way

postTitle: GHL Email Issue
postDescription: So I have a 6 email email campaign sequence workflow set up in GHL. All the links/photos/etc in the emails are hyperlinked. I've noticed now when someone clicks on ANY of the hyperlinked text (even "view this email in browser" and "unsubscribe from this email") that they get this message (below). author: Ralf Mbfy

If that's the case then this would be the perfect moment for you to connect your domain/auxiliary domain with GHL and configure it to be used when sending out your emails. Pretty sure there are how-to videos on Youtube on this, otherwise just ask ChatGPT 5.2 in Thinking mode, it's really amazing what precise instructions it can give you üòÉ

postTitle: If client has GHL account...
postDescription: Hey guys, was wondering if the option of having admin access to clients GHL account was ideal to manage our android there, would that create any unnecessary friction? Would it be best to stick with our go to setup?
author: Daniel Fawcett
reply:
Never do it inside the clients HL account as once you import the snapshot etc they then have all your IP and can go it alone. Do it inside your HL account under a new subaccount.
If they persist then charge them 10k for the build. Tell them that they are getting access to your IP forever so thats why it will cost.

postTitle: Help with 0-Workflow
postDescription: I downloaded a small amount of contacts to get started (350) and started dripping yesterday at the 100/day. But after it hit the 100, it continued to drip unsuccessfully because of the limit but now those people are getting the second message. How do I make it stop after the 100?
author: Daniel Fawcett
reply:
How have you dripped the leads in, via adding to automation on the contacts screen or by a drip node inside the workflow?
The 100 drip a day is done on a 24 hr cycle not a daily cycle. So if you drip 100 leads through at 9am then the next 100 will go through at 9am tomorrow.
Are you saying the workflow has dripped more than 100 though in 1 day?

postTitle: Using N8N as opposed to Zapier
postDescription: Hi guys i‚Äôm using N8N as that‚Äôs what i‚Äôm more used to using, does anyone have the prince charming json file they can send through to me please (mentioned in dans YT video) as i can‚Äôt seem to find it in the community. Many thanks hope everyone is well.
author: Ralf Mbfy
reply:
@Archie Conlon very simple to do, basically it's just a few steps:
(1) grab the required data from the incoming GHL webhook
(2) put that data into the correct format for a request to the OpenAI API
(3) send request to OpenAI API
(4) grab the AI reply from the request response JSON
(5) put that AI reply into the correct format for a request to the GHL API
(6) update the GHL contact on the field {{contact.chatgpt}} with the API reply via a PUT API request
I've implemented those exact steps not in N8N but in a small php component, and it's working like a charm! üòÉüëç

postTitle: What am I doing wrong?
postDescription: I've seen multiple posts where people close their very first coffee dates with ease. I've had 5 coffee dates so far (demos) and not one wants to continue with me! Don't get me wrong, I'm not complaining, I'm just worried that I might be doing something wrong. I'm going through the solar panel demo on OpenAI to show them how it works, and I even let them have a play with it exactly like in the PC Day 2 video. Everything goes to plan, I think it all goes brilliantly. I tell them about performance-ba... See more
author: Daniel Fawcett
reply:
Don't pitch them what it will cost them straight away.
Tell them you would like to run a small test for free, on about 500-1k of their leads to make sure it works well for their leads and biz.
Then hopefully you should get good results off of test then you can broach the subject of what it will cost them. If they see the value they will bite your hand off, if not then they wont.
It's not for some people and we accept that and move on.

I said I didn't think it works that way, but just thought I'd put this out there to the community to ask if this is even possible? You can't assign an existing number to an account and run messages from that number can you? You still have to buy one from GHL don't you?
author: Ralf Mbfy

postTitle: Client's Phone vs. Buying One From GHL
postDescription: I was on a call with a prospect (who has now become what will be my 2nd client) and he asked me if instead of applying for a GHL phone number, could he use his own number? I said I didn't think it works that way, but just thought I'd put this out there to the community to ask if this is even possible? You can't assign an existing number to an account and run messages from that number can you? You still have to buy one from GHL don't you?
author: Daniel Fawcett
reply:
Tell them that your SOP is to get a new number as it protects the number reputation of their existing number and makes setup a breeze.
You can always forwards calls and push messages notifications out to their existing number if they wish but it's easier to just get a new number.

postTitle: Question Running DBR For A Franchise
postDescription: Through a cold email campaign I have the potential to work with a franchise location. My question is if I wanted to run a DBR campaign for them do I still need to go through the same A2P process? This is the first time I've ran into this and was wondering if the process with a franchise is different or not?
author: Daniel Fawcett
reply:
If you want each franchise to have it own subaccount then yes you will need to do A2P each time.
You can get around this by doing a general A2P for the parent business name and then each franchise can have its own number. You assign the number to a staff member and then you adjust your workflows and dynamic data to include the franchise location (so its relevant) and then they will get messaged from that staff member, phone number etc but all in 1 subaccount.
That's the, excuse the pun, High Level overview. Few more bits to do to get it working 100% though

postTitle: Pricing/Packaging
postDescription: For anyone who is offering services like speed to lead, reputation management, DBR, etc...how do you package/price it?
author: Daniel Fawcett
reply:
Got a few of those options in play.
It all depends on the business and what they are happy to pay. Some might like 50/50 but dont get enough profit themselves afterwards.
Some will hate the 50/50 and prefer a monthly retainer and/or a price per lead.
You need to get on a call and feel them out to see what they are happy to pay etc

postTitle: High-ticket AI deals, what‚Äôs your payment flow?
postDescription: If you‚Äôre turning "trash can assets" into $10k‚Äì$100k+ paydays... How do you price your high-ticket offers? And what payment setup gets clients to commit fastest? Wanting to unlock a cleaner process. Any advice helps. TIA
author: Daniel Fawcett
reply:
Go 50/50 but it depends if they want to split 50/50 with you.
You can ask on the coffee date what their average order value is or average profit and just say for each lead i send you (no matter if they buy or not) i want x. You get paid early and more often but obviously less.
Gotta feel the business out and what they are comfortable with paying etc. Some business like the 50/50 profits but then realise that will not leave them enough profit to make it sustainable so always have a backup option in your pocket ready to go

postTitle: Thoughts on websites?
postDescription: Anyone getting anywhere without a website? If so are you outreaching from gmail or another way? Got a site in development but not ready for 4 weeks (nor is the domain gonna be warm for that time)
author: Daniel Fawcett
reply:
The demo website in the snapshot is a great starting place and you can get it linked to your domain in less than 30 mins.
It is not the be all and end of things, but I it is probably better to have a website.
If you are reaching out to your warm network then you have the trust factor on your side a bit more so you can say you are still building it out and hope to get it done soon. As long as you can get on Coffee Dates then you should be able to sell without a website

postTitle: Review automation flipped a clinic‚Äôs public image fast.
postDescription: Reviews are social proof. You already know that. Most businesses still hope customers remember to leave one. They rarely do. This week I set up a simple review workflow for a dental clinic. Cal.com + their phone receptionist. Every completed appointment now triggers a review cycle. A few things surprised them. ‚Ä¢ Responses went up when the follow-up felt gentle ‚Ä¢ Daily reminders didn‚Äôt bother anyone because they were personal ‚Ä¢ Link tracking showed exactly who needed another nudge ‚Ä¢ Their Google rating star... See more

postTitle: Every single message must require an opt-out?

author: Ralf Mbfy
reply: @Rob Andolina GHL only enforces it on the very first one, so that's the technical side of it. Depending on the jurisdiction you (and/or the SMS recipient) are/is in, the actual legal requirements might be stricter so prob best to consult with a local lawyer.

postTitle: Every single message must require an opt-out?

reply: Only the first message (and you have the ability to adapt that once your account is out of RAMP) - But in general it's advised to have it in there for compliance (but as we talk about in the book and the challenge, there are softer options while staying compliant)

postTitle: Speed to Lead pricing model
postDescription: I have a client who wants to implement the speed to lead agent. Does anyone have advice on how to price it? I was thinking a flat monthly fee but I‚Äôm unsure what to charge for it.
author: Gavin Miles
reply:
My advice is, don't have a price upfront. Talk to them, figure out what a lead is worth to them, how much do they pay for each lead, how much they pay for their salespeople...
And build a deal that works for both of you. That way, you're leading, not convincing

postTitle: Speed to Lead pricing model
postDescription: I have a client who wants to implement the speed to lead agent. Does anyone have advice on how to price it? I was thinking a flat monthly fee but I‚Äôm unsure what to charge for it.
author: Gavin Miles
reply: @Rob Andolina Not necesarily - it's what works for them - with speed to lead it's slightly different from DBR as its not 'found money' its more about increasing sales conversion rates and either replacing staff or helping with efficiencies. So effectively - you want to share '50/50' on the improvements you are making - but with S2L it's not as clear cut as DBR - if you know what I mean, but the principles are the same

postTitle: Low database
postDescription: Hey guys, I am sure this has been disccussed before but skool doesnt allow for key word search. How many leads should a business have in order for us to be able to work with them. some of the businesses i talk to. they dont have any structure or any crm to track leads. So i wanted to ask how many leads is enough to run test + full launch. 2000? 3000?
author: Daniel Fawcett
reply:
You only need 1k for a test. You dont want to burn too much cash if the leads are crap and you can easily tell this with the responses from 1k leads.
Full launch as many as you can get, 10k min ideally, for a DBR, so you got some length of time to run things whilst they get in more leads and you can then sell them on the S2L

postTitle: Health care/HIPAA
postDescription: Hello! Has anyone targeted a healthcare niche/done SMS outreach that's HIPAA compliant? Any tips or things to know? Thanks!
author: Daniel Fawcett
reply:
To be HIPAA compliant, it is not just SMS send/receive. It's your whole processes around data collection, storage, usage, deletion and everything else.
How do you get your leads from your client, csv over email? direct upload from client into HL? API'd in?
If by email, is you email secure, not just "I'm using Google" but what about your password, is it strong? Using 2FA etc?
To be HIPAA compliant you need to go through some things and make sure everything is ticked off properly etc.
GHL is not HIPAA by default and to make it its an add-on at 297 per month

In the videos there's playground and options to create a new project in video 3 of PC about 5mins in do we start in the default project or create a new project starting out also can't find any video where is shows how to create a new project with this new interface. If anyone can get pass this step thanks for the help. Or can guide me.
author: Daniel Fawcett
reply:
There are couple of ways to do this:
Start a new project for each client
Have a couple of projects where you have AI costs included in your deal (you pay the costs) and another where the client pays the costs (if you do the deal where they pay AI and SMS costs too)
Then inside each project you want to create a new API key for each client so that you can disable per client if required etc.
To create a new one, click on projects at the top left and Create Project

postTitle: Fee Structure for S2L and Review Automation Setup
postDescription: S2L I assume can stay same as DBR. 50/50 rev share, same with the 48 hour bot, but what about a fixed cost for setting up and running review automations? What are people charging for this? I assume something lower ticket
author: Daniel Fawcett
reply:
Answered this in the other thread - you can do it for about $1 per lead/review so 1k for 1k leads etc. Obviously depends on size of db and how many new leads/customers they have coming through etc.
Can always start small at 99 a month for 100 leads/reviews processed and then scale if they like it and have more leads etc

postTitle: Minimum lead database number you guys would work with
postDescription: Trying to set some SOPs here. 1k lead database seems kinda low to set as a minimum. What lead database list size minimums do you guys have in order to work with a partner

1k of really warm leads on a great product/service could be better than 10k cold leads on something people are not really interested in.
As a minimum you want 500 for a test campaign, so looking at 5k really ideally as a whole size. That is for DBR.

postTitle: CRM interface
postDescription: If a prospect uses Salesforce and also has Marketo (which also has SMS functionality but they‚Äôre not using it for database reactivation as yet) will GoHighLevel potentially interface with these platforms and automatically update a lead record with the SMS activity?
author: Daniel Fawcett
reply:
You will need to use the API and create an automation to sync data back to Salesforce once it is qualified or whenever you want it.
It's an effort so only do that if you are going to get paid for the build. For the test, just push the leads to a google sheet or get them booked into a calendar for their sales team to call.
Then if it works, they see the value then you can negotiate a proper deal and decide to build that out inclusive or charge for it

postTitle: Importing snapshot into an existing sub-account
postDescription: Hi all, just a quick question here; I already have an agency sub-account that existed before I started with this training. Is it possible to import the snapshot without setting up another sub-account and use the old one instead?
author: Daniel Fawcett
reply:
Yes you can import as many snapshots as you like. When you click on the snapshot URL and import it, it just sits in your agency account.
Then when you create a new subaccount, you import the snapshot to the subaccount.
You can import as many snapshots to agency level as you wish and as many into a subaccount as you wish. Just got to be very careful of collisions with custom field names, forms, automations etc so I would recommend starting a new subaccount unless you really know what you are doing.
There is no going back once you import into the subaccount

@John Susko in regards to your question regarding speeding up the agent's reply, I'd start with lowering the configured wait time on the '1 - Create Response' workflow from 1 min to 0.1 min (see screenshot) which would take 54 secs off the clock.

postTitle: Hallelujah - my Prince Charming Demo is working !!!

reply:
@John Susko If you are testing, first off test the prompt in the OpenAI playground thoroughly so you are not eating SMS costs and you get instant replies.
Once that is done then you can move to SMS check and then you just need to do a 2/3 test to make sure the SMS is being delivered to the phone and reply coming back in and the lead can naivigate through all the workflows on whatever response they give (i.e go to full qualification and booking or dont want it so DND'd)

postTitle: SMS tool swap
postDescription: If I traded the native LC Phone with a third party app to avoid certain restrictions and limitations, should i change anything in the workflow or zaps? OR will it just work? Under 'Phone System' I've changed the Telephony Provider to the third party app. It is connected and has a phone number in place.
author: Ralf Mbfy
reply:
@Quinten Decleyn Are you using their marketplace app? If so, you should be able to go to Settings > Phone System > Additional Settings and set Smstools as the Telephony Provider for that GHL subaccount.
And that would be everything on the (native) GHL side that you'd have to do (if I'm not mistaken). There probably will be additional config steps during the installation of their marketplace app, but I guess you'll get smoothly guided through that.

postTitle: Need Help: Calendar Type for Client Google Calendar Sync
postDescription: Hey everyone, quick question üëã I‚Äôm setting up a calendar in GoHighLevel for a client who wants their leads to be able to book either a Google Meet call or a phone call. The leads will be using my GHL calendar link, but the booked appointments need to sync directly into my client's Google Calendar, not mine. What‚Äôs the best calendar type to use for this ‚Äî Personal, Round Robin, or Event?And what‚Äôs the correct setup so that all bookings automatically go to the client‚Äôs Google Calendar? Thanks for the help!
author: Ralf Mbfy
reply: @Hector Cruzado Go for a 'Personal' calendar. For the calendar sync, inside of your client's GHL subaccount go to Calendars > Calendar Settings > + Add New and connect with their Google Calendar. Make sure to select the sync in BOTH directions so that the new bookings get synced OUT to your client's Google Calendar. The rest of the setup should be straight forward.

@Paul Mc Keown that's CORRECT behavior as it should be. A webhook is a ONE-WAY pushout of data to an external system (here: Zapier), and once GHL has 'fired' that webhook then it's done so it moves into the PAST section.
What follows is this: Zapier grabs the required info from the incoming webhook, uses that info to do a API request on the OpenAI API which returns the AI answer. And in a last step the Zapier zap then goes ahead and updates the very same contact on the custom field {{contact.chat... See more

author: Daniel Fawcett
reply:
@Ralf Mbfy it's not HTML formatting. HTML is different.
This is markdown format.
SMS is plain text so the markdown is converted to plain text hence the "double link" which is the markdown format.
Asking it to send the link in plain text does exactly that, send in plain text with no formatting so it can be put in SMS easily.
